SENT.plain: A total of 8,316 barbers were followed up from 1976 to 1987 to examine the relations between hair dye use and deaths from hematopoietic disorders
Three leukemia deaths and two malignant lymphoma deaths were observed in this cohort
The observed deaths were less than the expected number calculated from age- and sex-specific mortality of the general population in Japan (3.8 and 3.0, respectively)
No deaths from aplastic anemia or the other hematopoietic disorders were observed
